title: Grand Theft Cosmo
instructions: Shake all ingredients over ice and strain into martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist or a cranberry.
backstory: Named because Ashley stole this from me after I first made it and claimed it as her own.
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Solerno.

title: Tina-rita
instructions: Combine all ingredients and stir until agave dissolved. Pour over ice into salt rimmed glass.
backstory: Formerly called the Tiffany from HR-rita. The mixing of the drink was typical preceded by a call from Tina starting off with 'You are not going to believe this sh*t!'
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Grand Marnier.

title: Passenger Seat (The Sunday Cocktail)
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into lowball glass with a large ice cube
backstory: Modeled after the classic Sidecar cocktail. This is also known as Ashley's Sunday cocktail since she enjoys sipping this while watching the Green Bay Packers.
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Solerno.

title: Empress Polly
instructions: Combine ingredients (including the lemon rind) and shake over ice. Strain into a martini glass leaving out the rind. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Created for Miss Polly at the beginning of Covid for an outdoor dinner.

title: Sixty Miles From Belfast
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into lowball glass with a large ice cube. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry
backstory: Inspired by Ashley's client at the time who was in Northern Ireland. Bushmills is about 60 miles from Belfast.

title: I Want Something Orange
instructions: Combine ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
backstory: Ashley was sitting on the deck looking over the lake and said 'I want something orange.'
subs: Triple Sec can be substituted for Cointreau.

title: Crazy Daisy
instructions: Rinse martini glass with absinthe. Combine remaining ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Created one evening when Ashley was fed up with Daisy (one of our English bulldogs).

title: A Touch of Spring
instructions: Pour sparkling wine into a coupe glass. Combine remaining ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into the coupe glass with the wine. Garnish with a lemon twist,
backstory: A cocktail for an early Spring day. Photo credit to Tiffany.

title: The Everly
instructions: Combine first three ingredients into a shaker with ice and stir. Strain into a martini glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Inspired by the birth of the beautiful Everly on 11-15-2022. A cocktail as elegant and beautiful as she.

title: Dog Park
instructions: Combine gin, lemon juice, and simple syrup into a shaker with ice and stir. Strain into a coupe glass. Top with the sparkling wine. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Created for Ashley after coming back from a trip to the dog park with Penelope (one of our English bulldogs).
subs: Prosecco can be substituted for the sparking rose.

title: Running Off With The Princess
ingredients: Empress 1908 Elderflower Rose, St. Germain, Solerno, Cranberry
instructions: Combine ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an orange twist.
backstory: Ashley requested something similar to a Grand Theft Cosmo...but different.
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Solerno.

title: La Marguerite
ingredients: Reposado Tequila, Grand Marnier, Lime, Brut Sparkling Wine
instructions: Shake first three ingredients over ice and strain into champagne flute. Top with sparkling wine.
backstory: Ashley's creation. Margarita meets French 75.

title: South Of The Border Flyover
instructions: Mix together and serve in lowball glass with a large ice cube. Garnish with an orange twist.
backstory: Ashley asked for a margarita-esque cocktail to sip while watching Super Bowl LVII. Inspired by the classic Paper Plane cocktail.

title: Blissful Oblivion
ingredients: Hpnotiq, Tanqueray Rangpur, Absolut Mango, Triple Sec
instructions: Combine ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into a coupe glass.
backstory: Inspired by Miss Polly’s request for an after dinner fireside cocktail.

title: Polly-Colada
instructions: Combine ingredients and shake over ice. Strain into a martini glass. Optionally add 1 oz of skim milk. Garnish with a pineapple wedge. Alternatively, can be served in a hurricane glass over ice with a straw.
backstory: Created for Polly who loves pina coladas, but did not want the extra calories. Adding the milk gives the drink a classic pina colada flare.

title: Gus Gus
instructions: Combine first three ingredients in a shaker and then add the honey. Stir until honey is completely dissolved. Pour into lowball glass over ice. Garnish with lime twist or honey stick.
backstory: Honoring Gus' addition to the Irresistibulls. A little sweet and a little mischievous.

title: Five Star Recruit Spritz
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker over ice and stir. Pour into large wine glass and top with the sparkling wine. Add ice. Garnish with lemon wheel.
backstory: Named on Daisy’s gotcha day has a new five-star recruit to the Irresistibulls bulldog team.
subs: Aperol can be substituted for the Cappelletti. In that case, use 1/4 oz lemon juice.

title: Happily Ever After
instructions: Can be shaken and strained into a martini glass or served over ice in a lowball glass.
backstory: Created for Tiffany and Grant’s wedding reception. Grant recommends a vodka floater.
subs: Triple Sec can be substituted for Cointreau.

title: Blue Pontoon
ingredients: Malibu Mango, Blue Curacao, Pineapple, Sprite
instructions: Pour into a hurricane glass and top with ice. Garnish with an orange wheel. Add a straw.
backstory: Created for Sterling's 21st birthday pontoon booze cruise.

title: The Auggie
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker over ice and stir. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Created for Auggie, aka Auggie the Dauggie, aka Ron. One of the OG Irresistibulls.

title: Barrie Manhattan
instructions: Combine ingredients in a shaker over ice and stir. Strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Created by Barrie. She is the ultimate Manhattan mixologist. We miss seeing you Barrie!

title: Black Forest Manhattan
instructions: Combine ingredients and pour into lowball glass over large ice cube. Garnish with Luxardo cherry.
backstory: An after dinner dessert style Manhattan.

title: Distinguished Gentleman
instructions: Combine ingredients in shaker over ice. Strain into martini glass. Garnish with Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Created in honor of Big Bruiser.

title: If Wisconsin Created The Manhattan
ingredients: Woodford Reserve, Solerno, St. Germain, Luxardo Maraschino
instructions: Combine ingredients and pour into lowball glass over large ice cube. Garnish with Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Created while brainstorming cocktails for a Morrison family visit. A bit of a spoof on the Wisconsin Old Fashioned. Of course, if Wisconsin did create the Manhattan it would have been call the Milwaukee.
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Solerno.

title: Momma Lexi
instructions: Combine ingredients in shaker over ice. Strain into coupe glass. Garnish with Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Created in memory of Momma Lexi.

title: Mi Hermano
instructions: Combine and pour into lowball glass over large ice cube. Garnish with slice of lime.
backstory: Made for my brother Spencer.

title: Elderrita
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker and stir until agave dissolved. Pour over ice. Salt rimmed glass is optional.
backstory: Ashley requested an elderflower margarita.
subs: Cointreau or Triple Sec can be substituted for Solerno.

title: Party Time
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into a fun glass. Add a maraschino cherry and a straw.
backstory: The drink has a Barbie pink color and goes down quickly. It's original name was the Panty Dropper.

title: Cold Brandone
instructions: Pour bourbon into an ice filled rocks glass and top with Coke Zero.
backstory: We recognize this is basically a whiskey and coke. But it is THE drink for Brandon.

title: Bon Mom
instructions: Combine first three ingredients into a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with club soda.
backstory: Created for Bon when she called and requested a cocktail idea.
subs: For those that like a sweeter drink, add a bit more simple or swap the club soda for Sprite.

title: Princess Penelope
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: For her Royal Highness, Princess Penelope Mae Boofington, Duchess of Hall. Penelope is the Irresistibull that started it all. The peach reflects her Georgia roots. She loves lounging in the sun and yellow is her color. Hence, the cocktail's sunny hue.

title: Lemony Snicket
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Yellow chartreuse and cassis were the inspiring ingredients. Named while sipping cocktails in Ashley's library.

title: Sexy George
instructions: Pour sparkling wine into a coupe glass. Combine first four ingredients in a shaker over ice, stir, and strain into the wine filled coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Made for Ashley when she wanted something with absinthe.

title: Evening Spritz
instructions: Stir Honey Bubbles and grapefruit juice with ice to chill. Pour into a Collins glass. Top with the Honey Bubbles. Add ice and a straw.
backstory: Ashley wanted something with grapefruit to enjoy when sitting outside one summer evening. You can use Prosecco if you can't find Honey Bubbles.
subs: Prosecco can be substituted for the Honey Bubbles.

title: Dammit Chris
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into rocks glass with a large ice cube. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Made for Ashley one evening while planning a Morrison family visit and Chris just wouldn't book the flights. Later on, 'Dammit Chris' was muttered by Janice after he spilled the movie night popcorn. Photo credit to Janice.

title: Tardy To The Party
instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into rocks glass with a large ice cube. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.
backstory: Created by Scott as an impromptu challenge to use Averna in a cocktail. And yes...he showed up late.

title: Birthday Girl
instructions: Pour Honey Bubbles into a martini glass. Combine the vodka, grapefruit juice, Grand Marnier, and simple syrup into a shake with ice and stir. Strain into the martini glass. Garnish with a grapefruit twist.
backstory: Created for the lovely Ashley on her 33rd birthday.
subs: Prosecco can be substituted for the Honey Bubbles.

title: Hot Drink, Cold Night
ingredients: Ketel One Orange, Hornitos Black Barrel, Lime, Simple, Serrano, Cilantro
instructions: Use one small serrano pepper or about 2 inches of a larger pepper and cut into four pieces. Add serrano and 6-8 sprigs of fresh cilantro into a shaker, add lime juice, and muddle well. Add the remaining ingredients and stir together. Strain through a wire mesh into another shaker with ice. Stir well. Rim half of a coupe glass with Tajin. Strain cocktail into rimmed coupe glass.
backstory: It was an unseasonably cold winter night in Georgia and Ashley wanted something spicy.
subs: Vary the amount of serrano based on your spice tolerance and the heat of your pepper.

title: Hope
instructions: Muddle blackberries in a shaker. Add remaining ingredients and muddle again. Strain through wire strainer into another shaker with ice. Stir well. Strain again while pouring into a martini glass. Garnish with a blackberry.
backstory: Realize time with loved ones is priceless and not forever. While sipping, reflect back on how T. Blake touched your life.

title: Mr. Stox Martini
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with two tomolives.
backstory: We cannot take credit for creating this one. It comes from Mr. Stox steakhouse in Anaheim, CA (now closed). My dad ordered this martini for us when we were traveling.
subs: The tomolives can be exchanged for cocktail onions or regular olives, but the tomolives make the difference.

title: Sapphire in Bloom
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice and strain into a coupe glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Ashley said, 'Surprise me but it must have lemon'. The violet was the surprise.

title: That is Delightful
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a shaker over ice, stir well, and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
backstory: Ashley wanted a classic style martini with an interesting twist.
subs: Old Raj red label can be used also. Stick with Old Raj for the gin as the infused saffron adds to the drink.

title: Through the Valley
instructions: Combine first three ingredients in a shaker over ice, stir well, and strain into a coupe glass. Top with the Honey Bubbles. Garnish with a orange twist.
backstory: Ashley asked for something with the St. George Valley. A new find that day.
subs: Prosecco can be substituted for the Honey Bubbles.

title: Lavender Lemon
instructions: Combine all ingredients except the sugar in a shaker over ice and stir well. Rim a coupe glass with the lavender sugar. Strain the drink into the rimmed glass.
backstory: One night I was looking for a reason to use the lavender sugar.

title: Sconnie Girl (aka Bloody Mary)
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large glass and stir well. Fill with ice. Garnish with your favorite Bloody Mary toppings.
backstory: Ashley (a Wisconsin native) also calls this 'The recovery drink of my people.' Everyone from Wisconsin knows that Bloody Marys are religion. The first time I made Ashley a Bloody Mary, I was so worked up about getting the flavor of the mix just right, I forgot to add the vodka! That makes it a Bloody Shame.
